div.h2: Apple Information Security - Security Data Analyst
div.p: This role is responsible for helping to strengthen Apple’s information security posture through the identification and curation of security event data. individual will have a significant role in building out the next generation of Apple’s security event monitoring capability, including: - Data evaluation - improve Apple’s security posture by providing feedback on quality of data generated by applications - Application event reviews - review applications to ensure the events generated meet the goals of Apple’s Information Security program - Application on-boarding - work with Apple application teams to ensure critical events are making it to Information Security Position can be located in either Austin, TX or Sunnyvale, CA.

ul.li: Ability to work with partner teams to help guide logging strategy and guidelines
Understanding of large-scale data storage and analysis platforms such as Hadoop, Splunk, Elasticsearch, Arcsight, or Greylog
Experience with event log ingestion and transport mechanisms - including syslog, Logstash, Fluentd, Flume, or Kafka
Familiarity with human readable data formats such as JSON, XML, YAML
Understanding of logging capabilities and best practices of Linux, UNIX, Windows based operating systems
Application security knowledge and attack detection concepts
Experience in incident response, systems administration, network engineering, scalable architectures, or software operation

div.p: • Influence what data sources need to be collected to allow Information Security to better protect Apple employees and customers from a wide range of threats • Act as the subject matter expert for security event logging on behalf of the Information Security organization • Analyze and assess application, system, and appliance event logs for relevancy to Apple’s threat monitoring program • Own relationships with application teams to better understand log messages and guide the implementation of security log requirements • Identify opportunities to improve security event logging Apple-wide • Develop standard metrics to measure the effectiveness of Apple’s Information Security logging program, including the assessment of the quality of log data received • Provide first level support for end users of the log ingestion pipeline • Monitor the quality and quantity of logs being sent to Information Security and resolve discrepancies detected by the monitoring platform
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent, hands-on experience
Off hours / On call support required due to the 24x7 nature of this team
